article.headline: Nasdaq marks 2nd straight record close and 8th straight gain as tech-related shares lead stock-market rally
article.body: U.S. stocks finished Tuesday solidly in positive territory, but well off the highs of the session, with technology-related names leading an updraft for stocks. The Nasdaq Composite Index COMP, +1.39% finished up 0.7% at 10,131, marking the second straight all-time closing high for the tech-heavy benchmark and its 8th straight gain. The Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.56% closed up 0.5% higher at 26,156, while the S&P 500 index SPX, +0.87% closed 0.4% higher at 3,131, buoyed by the tech sector SP500.45, +1.54% and communication services. Apple Inc. AAPL, +1.74% closed up 2.1%, notching a fresh record for the iPhone maker and Dow component, a day after its Worldwide Developers Conference and a series of announcements of hardware and software changes.
